newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-MIM says second half to be better.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-MIM says second half to be better.

text.p: MIM Holdings Ltd chief executive Nick Stump said on Friday the Australia-based resources company should emerge from the current half year in better shape.
"We're in a stronger position for the second half," Stump told a press conference.
He said the first half (July-December) operating loss of $A400,000 announced earlier on Friday was not unexpected "given the copper fiasco of last year."
"We've got to look beyond that and we've come out in the second half in a much stronger shape," he said.
The reduction in MIM's half-year dividend to 1.25 Australian cents a share from 2.5 cents a year ago, was related to the "uncertainty in copper," Stump said.
MIM produces a range of base metals, most notably copper.
The company is expanding its Mount Isa copper mine and is developing two additional mines, Ernest Henry, also in Queensland, and Alumbrera in Argentina.
It also is increasing copper smelting capacity at Mount Isa to 250,000 tonnes a year from the current 175,000 tonnes.
MIM has said that every one cent move in the copper price over a year means A$3.77 million to the bottom line for the company.
